channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-15541] Hive OOM when ATSHook enabled and ATS goes down
item.description:
The ATS API used by the Hive ATSHook is a blocking call, if ATS goes down this can block the ATSHook executor, while the hook continues to submit work to the executor with each query.
Over time the buildup of queued items can cause OOM.
item.summary: Hive OOM when ATSHook enabled and ATS goes down

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: One solution is to create the ATSHook executor with a bounded queue capacity so the hook does not submit new requests if it gets too full.

Here are the results of testing the latest attachment:
https://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12845686/HIVE-15541.1.patch

ATTACHMENT ID: 12845838 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

Hmm. Why not change the queue to reference requests created at enqueue time, instead of capturing huge amount of context in the runnable (unless I'm reading this wrong)?
In addition to queue limit.
That way queue limit could probably be set to a larger value.

Per sershe, creating the TimelineEntities before submitting to the ExecutorService. If there is concern that creating ATS events will take too much time on the main query thread, another option is to create another thread pool to create the ATS events, which then submit to the ATS logging thread.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12846668 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build

nit: whitespace in case PRE_EXEC_HOOK: is weird (statements are on different levels than other cases).
Why 64 and not 128 or 10240?
What I had in mind was a single thread drawing items out of the queue, w/o runnables. But this also work. +1, above can be fixed on commit
When the issue was first found, I think something like 100 queries was enough to hit OOM, so was trying to default this to a conservative number.

Per hagleitn, Creating the ATS event on the main query thread is expensive and should be done on a separate thread.
Will try creating a separate thread pool for sending the event to ATS, so that the existing executor does not get tied up in blocking calls.
sershe, can you take a look one more time?

fireAndForget does not need conf. Not sure if Java is smart enough to remove it from Runnable capture, I hope so (since it's not final and works anyway), but removing it would be harmless

+1 can be fixed on commit

Test were broken by HIVE-15297.
About fireAndForget() and conf, that variable is not final so it does not get used by the Runnable. Will remove.

Doc note: This adds hive.ats.hook.queue.capacity to HiveConf.java, so it needs to be documented in the wiki for release 2.2.0.

  • Configuration Properties – Query and DDL Execution

Added a TODOC2.2 label.
